data.q: Which function is used to check if a path exists?
data.e: os.path.exists(path) returns True if the path exists, whether it is a file or directory.

data.q: Which function checks if a path is a directory?
data.e: os.path.isdir(path) returns True if the path is a directory.

data.q: Which function checks if a path is a file?
data.e: os.path.isfile(path) returns True if the path is a regular file.

data.q: Which function creates a new directory?
data.e: os.mkdir(path) creates a new directory at the specified path.

data.q: Which function creates intermediate directories if they donâ€™t exist?
data.e: os.makedirs(path) creates all intermediate-level directories needed to contain the leaf directory.

data.q: Which function removes an empty directory?
Which function lists all files and directories in a given path?
data.e: os.listdir(path) returns a list of entries in the given directory.

data.q: Which function returns the absolute path of a file?
data.e: os.path.abspath(path) returns the absolute path of the given file or directory.

data.q: Which function splits a path into directory and file components?
data.e: os.path.split(path) returns a tuple (head, tail) where head is the directory and tail is the file name.
